title: Kanji
summary: Kanji (漢字, pronounced [kaɲdʑi] (listen)) are a set of logographic characters from Chinese script which forms a major part of the Japanese writing system alongside with Japanese syllabic scripts hiragana and katakana.[1][2] The Japanese term kanji for the Chinese characters literally means "Han characters".[3] It is written with the same characters as in traditional Chinese to refer to the character writing system, hanzi (漢字).[4]
